messages.original: After the fall of Redkodub to Russia, Lyman direction seems to be an area of significant Ukrainian manpower shortage currently. Recently, Russian forces have taken Novoselovka, Dibrova, Redkodub, and advanced around Korovyy Yar, Syatogorsk, and Lyman city. Again, it seems the Russian goal is to anchor the front along the Severskyy Donets river before crossing it, coordinated with a frontal assault from Seversk to Slavyansk.

Apologies for not covering the large missile attack on Ukraine today. I've been busy with unrelated stuff, but I'll start working on a map summary and will post the consequences of the attack later as usual.
Make sure to subscribe to 
@VodkaEcho
 for coverage when I'm not active, as they do a great job too.
The Ukrainian Ministry of Defense has officially stated that the Oreshnik targeted the territory of the Lviv State Aviation Repair Plant.
The Ukrainian Ministry of Defense has officially stated that the Oreshnik targeted the territory of the Lviv State Aviation Repair Plant.

Who could've guessed

OSINT wins again

Apologies for not covering the large missile attack on Ukraine today. I've been busy with unrelated stuff, but I'll start working on a map summary and will post the consequences of the attack later as usual.  Make sure to subscribe to @VodkaEcho for coverage‚Ä¶

Last night, another large-scale, combined Russian missile and drone attack was carried out on Ukraine.
Missiles launched:
~8 Iskander-M ballistic missiles launched from OTRK installations northeast of Simferopol, Crimea. 
~6 Iskander-M ballistic missiles launched from OTRK installations near Yeysk, Krasnodar Krai.
~4 Iskander-M ballistic missiles launched from OTRK installations northwest of Klintsy, Bryansk Oblast.
~3 Iskander-M ballistic missiles launched from OTRK installations in the vicinity of Belgorod City, Belgorod Oblast.
-----------------------
Total missiles launched:
~21 Iskander-M ballistic missiles.
-----------------------
Ukrainian air defence work:
As of the time of writing, Ukrainian air defence is confirmed to have intercepted at least 2 Iskander-Ms over Kyiv.
-----------------------
The main targets for this strike was Ukrainian energy infrastructure in. The following was targeted:
Trypillya Thermal Power Plant, Kyiv Oblast (50.13416, 30.74705) by ~1 Iskander-M.
Kryvyi Rih Thermal Power Plant, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast (47.5436, 33.66164) by ~8 Iskander-Ms.
"Zaporizka" 750 kV electrical substation, Zaporizhzhia Oblast (47.99956, 35.50957) by ~6 Iskander-Ms.
Kharkiv TEC-5 Combined Heat and Power Plant, Kharkiv Oblast (49.9707, 36.11154) by ~3 Iskander-Ms.
Unknown target in southern Kyiv City by ~1 Iskander-M. 
-----------------------
Keep in mind, the numbers of missiles launched may be slightly higher than what I've listed, as the number of missiles detected is often lower than actual launches.
It's also possible that additional missiles will be used tonight. If so, I will provide an updated map + summary.
There is an increased threat of Iskander-K cruise missile launches for the next 4 hours.

I'm never beating the Kremlin agent allegations 
ü§£

Scenes from the missile attack on Kyiv last night. 
4 Iskander-M ballistic missiles were used, two of which shot down over the city. The second video shows some of the Patriots which intercepted the missiles being launched.
1 impact was recorded to the Trypillya Thermal Power Plant, and a second to an unknown target in the southern part of Kyiv. The first video is likely of the latter. 
Credit to 
Intel Cams | OSINT
 for the second clip.

3 Impacts were recorded, along with several Geran-2 drone strikes.
Credit to

 for the first clip.

Footage of the Russian Iskander-M ballistic missile strikes on the Kharkiv TEC-5 Combined Heat and Power Plant.   3 Impacts were recorded, along with several Geran-2 drone strikes.  Credit to Intel Cams | OSINT for the first clip.
A large fire was seen burning in Kharkiv after the attack.

One of the explosions heard in Zelenodolsk, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast, earlier tonight. . 
Approximately 8 Iskander-M ballistic missiles and more than 20 Geran-2 drones struck the Thermal Power Plant there.
Iskander-M threat from Yeysk, Krasnodar Krai.

One of the explosions heard in Zelenodolsk, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast, earlier tonight. .   Approximately 8 Iskander-M ballistic missiles and more than 20 Geran-2 drones struck the Thermal Power Plant there.

NASA FIRMS data shows large fires burning at the Kryvyi Rih Thermal Power Plant in Zelenodolsk, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast, as a result of the earlier Iskander-M strikes.
Coordinates: 47.5436, 33.66164

The SDF continue to deploy reinforcements to the front in the Aleppo Governorate after clashes in Kurdish majority neighbourhoods in Aleppo city ended with a ceasefire and the evacuation of Asayish security personnel. 
This convoy is reportedly enroute to the Tishreen dam area. 
@wfwitness

Overnight, Odesa City once again came under attack from Russian Geran-2 drones.
Around a dozen impacts were recorded in the area of the City Centre / Moldavanka District. 
The target doesn't appear to have been energy infrastructure.

Ukraine Received Air Defense Buggy From U.S. (Video, Photos)
Ukraine has received the Tempest short-range air defense system from the United States, according to footage released by the country‚Äôs air force on January 10.
The Ukrainian Air Force‚Äô Command Center published a video that shows the Tempest repelling an attack in a new year‚Äôs post, without announcing or identifying the system. Later, a photo emerged online suggesting that the country may have gotten at least two such systems.
The main armament of the Tempest is two side-mounted AGM-114L Hellfire Longbow missiles. The AGM-114L, which has a range of around eight kilometers and carries a nine kilogram warhead, is guided via equipped with millimeter-wave active radar homing seeker.
Read more 
HERE

Russia‚Äôs Oreshnik Hit Lviv Plant Where Ukraine Repairs Fighter Jets And Manufactures Drones
The target of the January 9 Oreshnik missile strike was the Lviv State Aviation Repair Plant in western Ukraine, the Russian Ministry of Defense revealed.
In a statement released on January 12, the ministry said, citing several independent sources, that the intermediate-range ballistic missile (IRBM) disabled the aviation repair plant.
At the time of the strike, fighter jets of the Ukrainian Air Force, including American-made F-16s and Soviet-made MiG-29s supplied by the Western countries, were being maintained at the plant, the ministry added, noting that the plant also produced long-range and medium-range attack drones used to hit civilian facilities in ‚Äúthe depth of Russian territory.‚Äù
‚ÄúThe Oreshnik system engaged production workshops, warehouses with products (UAVs), as well as the infrastructure of the factory airfield,‚Äù the statement reads.
üëâ

HERE

Russian S-300 Unit Shot Down Ukrainian F-16 In Carefully-Planned Operation
A Russian air defense division has shot down an American-made F-16 fighter jet of the Ukrainian Air Force (UAF) in a carefully-planned operation, the division commander revealed in an interview aired by Russia 1 TV on January 11.
The commander, who goes by the call sign ‚ÄúSever,‚Äù told the news channel that his unit destroyed the aircraft using two missiles.
According to him, the division received the modernized S-300 system in December 2024, completed training by March 2025, and has since engaged numerous high-value targets.
‚ÄúWe have downed a colossal number of targets‚Äîwe‚Äôve lost count. These include ATACMS missiles, HIMARS rockets, guided aerial bombs, and other aerodynamic targets. The most interesting one was the F-16,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúOur opponent praises these aircraft highly, claiming they are nearly indestructible. It turns out they can be shot down just the same.‚Äù
üëâ

Ukraine Is Losing Ground To Russian Army In Zaporozhye Faster Than Ever (Videos)
On January 12, the Russian military captured another settlement in Zaporozhye from Kiev forces, with reports suggesting that sever other settlements are about to be cleared.
The capture of Novoboykovskoye, located to the east of Stepnohirsk, by the Vostok [East] Group of Forces was confirmed by the Russian Ministry of Defense. Russian troops stormed the settlement just a few days earlier. Kiev forces failed to put on any real resistance.
A similar situation is reportedly developing in Prymorske, to the northwest of Stepnohirsk, where Kiev forces have very much lost control of the large settlement.
According to preliminary reports, the last Ukrainian positions in the northern part of the Prymorske had been already captured, and work to fully secure the settlement is nearing completion. The Russian MoD could confirm the capture of the settlement within a few days.
Read more 
HERE

A WEEKEND OF STRATEGIC SHIFTS: RUSSIA GAINS GROUND AMID HIGH-INTENSITY FIGHTING

Russian-Ukrainian Strike Exchange: Black Sea Vessel Attacks, UK Unveils New Rocket Project For Ukraine
On the night of January 12, Russian air defense forces destroyed or suppressed 13 Ukrainian drones. The highest number was intercepted over the Rostov region. Simultaneously, the Ukrainian side reported intercepting or suppressing 135 out of 156 Russian attack UAVs. 
The day before, attention was drawn to published information about the start of design work in the UK on an operational-tactical ballistic missile for the Armed Forces of Ukraine, codenamed Nightfall. The $12.1 million R&D contract is distributed among three industrial groups, one of which is presumably MBDA Missile Systems. According to data that emerged as early as August 2025, the project's goal is to create a highly mobile missile system with a range exceeding 500 km (some reports say up to 600 km) and with low infrared and radar signatures.
üëâ

HERE

Control of Communications in Zaporizhzhia: Fight for Orikhiv‚Äôs Highways Escalates in Ukraine 
‚ñ™Ô∏è
In the Zaporizhzhia sector, the Russian army's control of Bilohiria and the interaction of the "Dnepr" and "West" groupings are creating prerequisites for an operational encirclement of the Orikhiv district. The key objective is to intercept the H-08 and T-04-08 highways. 
‚ñ™Ô∏è
In the Pokrovsk sector, following the conclusion of combat operations in Pokrovsk and Myrnohrad, Russian forces have advanced towards Bilytske and Shevchenko, while intense fighting continues in Hryshyne. 
‚ñ™Ô∏è
In the Kostiantynivka sector, fighting continues for Novodmytrivka and Predtechyne. Meanwhile, Russian assault detachments have advanced into the southeastern part of Kostiantynivka and captured strongpoints west of Stepanivka. 
‚ñ™Ô∏è
In the Sumy sector, Russian "North" assault units have significantly expanded their offensive front, advancing 14 sections in the Sumy district for a total of up to 850 meters.

HERE
